page.title: 16ST MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: St Mary's church is in the centre of Alverstoke village. Lots of people attend services there every week. The church has a tall, winding tower and a wooden lychgate. There is no room in the grave yard for any more graves (no one has been buried here for 10 years). Inside, the centre of the church is a gold painted brass lectern in the shape of a golden eagle. There is also a marble font and lots of plaques fixed to the walls. There is a golden bell on the tower, with the clock face in roman numerals. The bell is surrounded with finely carved gargoyles. The church is made of a strong type of stone and the roof of red slate.
